/app/src/ast.rs:
    1|       |//! Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) for C11 compiler.
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module provides the core AST data structures and APIs for representing
    4|       |//! C11 programs. The AST is designed as a flattened storage system for efficiency,
    5|       |//! with index-based references to child nodes and types.
    6|       |//!
    7|       |//! ## Architecture
    8|       |//!
    9|       |//! The AST is organized into focused submodules for better maintainability:
   10|       |//!
   11|       |//! - [`nodes`]: Node definitions, constructors, and builder patterns for AST nodes
   12|       |//! - [`types`]: Type system representation and utilities for semantic analysis
   13|       |//!
   14|       |//! ## Key Features
   15|       |//!
   16|       |//! - **Flattened Storage**: All AST nodes are stored in contiguous vectors with index-based references
   17|       |//! - **Interior Mutability**: Uses `Cell` for type annotations without requiring mutable AST access
   18|       |//! - **Builder Patterns**: Ergonomic constructors for complex AST nodes
   19|       |//! - **Type System**: Canonical types distinct from syntactic type specifiers
   20|       |//!
   21|       |
   22|       |use std::num::NonZeroU32;
   23|       |
   24|       |/// Represents an interned string using symbol_table crate.
   25|       |/// Alias for GlobalSymbol from symbol_table crate with global feature.
   26|       |pub type NameId = symbol_table::GlobalSymbol;
   27|       |pub type StringId = NameId;
   28|       |
   29|       |use crate::semantic::{QualType, ScopeId, SemanticInfo, SymbolRef, TypeRef, ValueCategory};

  152|  6.57k|            self.current += 1;
  153|  6.57k|            Some(node)
  154|       |        } else {
  155|  4.00k|            None
  156|       |        }
  157|  10.5k|    }
  158|       |
  159|       |    #[inline]
  160|     22|    fn size_hint(&self) -> (usize, Option<usize>) {
  161|     22|        let len = (self.end - self.current) as usize;
  162|     22|        (len, Some(len))
  163|     22|    }

  294|       |    /// Get function name from symbol entry reference
  295|      4|    fn get_function_name(symbol_ref: SymbolRef, symbol_table: Option<&SymbolTable>) -> String {
  296|      4|        if let Some(table) = symbol_table {
  297|      4|            let entry = table.get_symbol(symbol_ref);
  298|      4|            return entry.name.to_string();
  299|      0|        }
  300|      0|        format!("func_{}", symbol_ref.get())
  301|      4|    }

  303|       |    /// Format a DesignatedInitializer for display
  304|      4|    fn format_designated_initializer(init: &DesignatedInitializer, ast: &Ast) -> String {
  305|      4|        let mut result = String::new();
  306|      4|        for designator_ref in init.designator_start.range(init.designator_len) {
  307|      4|            match ast.get_kind(designator_ref) {
  308|      4|                NodeKind::Designator(d) => match d {
  309|      2|                    Designator::FieldName(name) => {
  310|      2|                        result.push_str(&format!(".{}", name));
  311|      2|                    }
  312|      2|                    Designator::ArrayIndex(index) => {
  313|      2|                        result.push_str(&format!("[{}]", index.get()));
  314|      2|                    }
  315|      0|                    Designator::GnuArrayRange(start, end) => {
  316|      0|                        result.push_str(&format!("[{} ... {}]", start.get(), end.get()));
  317|      0|                    }
  318|       |                },
  319|      0|                _ => result.push_str("<invalid designator>"),
  320|       |            }
  321|       |        }
  322|       |
  323|      4|        if init.designator_len > 0 {
  324|      4|            result.push_str(" = ");
  325|      4|        }
                      ^0
  326|       |
  327|      4|        result.push_str(&init.initializer.get().to_string());
  328|      4|        result
  329|      4|    }

  360|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\r"), "\r");
  361|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\b"), "\x08"); // BS
  362|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\f"), "\x0C"); // FF
  363|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\v"), "\x0B"); // VT
  364|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\a"), "\x07"); // BEL
  365|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\\"), "\\");
  366|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\'"), "\'");
  367|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r#"\""#), "\"");
  368|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"\?"), "?");
  369|       |

  371|      1|        assert_eq!(unescape_string(r"Hello\nWorld"), "Hello\nWorld");
  372|      1|    }

   14|       |/// The core enum defining all possible AST node types for C11.
   15|       |/// Variants use NodeIndex for child references, enabling flattened storage.

   18|       |
   19|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, Serialize)]
   20|       |pub enum NodeKind {
   21|       |    // --- Literals (Inline storage for common types) ---
   22|       |    Literal(Literal),
   23|       |
   24|       |    // --- Expressions ---
   25|       |    // Ident now includes a resolved SymbolRef after semantic analysis
   26|       |    Ident(NameId, SymbolRef),

   28|       |    BinaryOp(BinaryOp, NodeRef, NodeRef),

   34|       |

   87|       |
   88|       |    // --- Declarations & Definitions ---

   91|       |    EnumConstant(NameId, Option<NodeRef> /* value expr */),
   92|       |    StaticAssert(NodeRef /* condition */, NodeRef /* message */),
   93|       |

   97|       |    FunctionDecl(FunctionDeclData),

  105|       |
  106|       |    // --- Top Level ---

  108|       |

  112|       |    Designator(Designator),

  114|       |    // --- Dummy Node ---

  147|      0|fn f64_to_f128_bytes(val: f64) -> [u8; 16] {
  148|      0|    let bits = val.to_bits();
  149|      0|    let sign = (bits >> 63) & 1;
  150|      0|    let exp = (bits >> 52) & 0x7FF;
  151|      0|    let mant = bits & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFF;
  152|       |
  153|      0|    let (new_exp, new_mant) = if exp == 0 {
  154|      0|        if mant == 0 {
  155|       |            // Zero
  156|      0|            (0, 0)
  157|       |        } else {
  158|       |            // Subnormal f64 -> Normal f128
  159|       |            // mant is 0.bbbb... (52 bits)
  160|      0|            let lz = mant.leading_zeros() - (64 - 52);
  161|      0|            let shift = lz + 1;
  162|      0|            let normalized_mant = mant << shift;
  163|      0|            let payload = normalized_mant & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFF; // 52 bits
  164|       |
  165|      0|            let unbiased_exp = -1022 - (shift as i32);
  166|      0|            let biased_exp = unbiased_exp + 16383;
  167|       |
  168|      0|            (biased_exp as u64, (payload as u128) << (112 - 52))
  169|       |        }
  170|      0|    } else if exp == 0x7FF {
  171|       |        // Inf or NaN
  172|      0|        (0x7FFF, (mant as u128) << (112 - 52))
  173|       |    } else {
  174|       |        // Normal
  175|      0|        let unbiased_exp = (exp as i32) - 1023;
  176|      0|        let biased_exp = unbiased_exp + 16383;
  177|      0|        (biased_exp as u64, (mant as u128) << (112 - 52))
  178|       |    };
  179|       |
  180|      0|    let sign_bit = (sign as u128) << 127;
  181|      0|    let exp_bits = (new_exp as u128) << 112;
  182|      0|    let mant_bits = new_mant;
  183|       |
  184|      0|    let result = sign_bit | exp_bits | mant_bits;
  185|      0|    result.to_le_bytes()
  186|      0|}

  188|      8|fn f64_to_x87_bytes(val: f64) -> [u8; 16] {
  189|      8|    let bits = val.to_bits();
  190|      8|    let sign = (bits >> 63) & 1;
  191|      8|    let exp = (bits >> 52) & 0x7FF;
  192|      8|    let mant = bits & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFF;
  193|       |
  194|      8|    let mut out = [0u8; 16];
  195|       |
  196|      8|    if exp == 0 {
  197|      0|        if mant == 0 {
  198|       |            // Zero
  199|      0|            if sign == 1 {
  200|      0|                out[9] = 0x80;
  201|      0|            }
  202|      0|            return out;
  203|      0|        }
  204|       |
  205|       |        // Subnormal f64
  206|       |        // Calculate leading zeros in the 52-bit mantissa
  207|       |        // 12 zeros because u64 has 64 bits but mant only 52
  208|      0|        let lz = mant.leading_zeros() - 12;
  209|       |
  210|       |        // Shift to make MSB 1 (integer bit for x87)
  211|       |        // We want to put the first '1' at bit 63.
  212|       |        // Currently it is at (51 - lz).
  213|       |        // Shift left by 63 - (51 - lz) = 12 + lz.
  214|      0|        let new_mant = mant << (12 + lz);
  215|       |
  216|       |        // Exponent calculation
  217|       |        // Real exponent of f64 subnormal is -1022.
  218|       |        // We effectively shifted left by (lz + 1) to normalize (because we moved 0.1... to 1.0...)
  219|       |        // So we must subtract (lz + 1) from exponent.
  220|      0|        let real_exp = -1022 - (lz as i32 + 1);
  221|       |
  222|       |        // x87 bias 16383
  223|      0|        let new_exp_biased = (real_exp + 16383) as u16;
  224|       |
  225|      0|        out[0..8].copy_from_slice(&new_mant.to_le_bytes());
  226|      0|        out[8..10].copy_from_slice(&new_exp_biased.to_le_bytes());
  227|      0|        if sign == 1 {
  228|      0|            out[9] |= 0x80;
  229|      0|        }
  230|      0|        return out;
  231|      8|    } else if exp == 0x7FF {
  232|       |        // Inf or NaN
  233|      0|        out[8] = 0xFF;
  234|      0|        out[9] = 0x7F | ((sign as u8) << 7);
  235|       |
  236|      0|        if mant == 0 {
  237|      0|            // Infinity: Integer bit 1, mantissa 0
  238|      0|            out[7] = 0x80;
  239|      0|        } else {
  240|      0|            // NaN: Set integer bit 1
  241|      0|            // f64 mantissa is 52 bits. x87 is 63 bits.
  242|      0|            // Shift left by 11.
  243|      0|            let new_mant = (1u64 << 63) | (mant << 11);
  244|      0|            out[0..8].copy_from_slice(&new_mant.to_le_bytes());
  245|      0|        }
  246|      0|        return out;
  247|      8|    }
  248|       |
  249|       |    // Normal f64
  250|      8|    let unbiased_exp = (exp as i32) - 1023;
  251|      8|    let new_exp = (unbiased_exp + 16383) as u16;
  252|       |
  253|       |    // Explicit integer bit 1 for Normal numbers in x87
  254|      8|    let new_mant = (1u64 << 63) | (mant << 11);
  255|       |
  256|      8|    out[0..8].copy_from_slice(&new_mant.to_le_bytes());
  257|      8|    out[8..10].copy_from_slice(&new_exp.to_le_bytes());
  258|       |
  259|       |    // Sign bit in byte 9, bit 7
  260|      8|    if sign == 1 {
  261|      0|        out[9] |= 0x80;
  262|      8|    }
  263|       |
  264|      8|    out
  265|      8|}

  338|     11|            Ok(())

  391|      0|                let remaining = array_layout.size as usize - emitted_size;

  400|       |/// Emit a constant value to the output buffer based on its type layout
  401|    762|pub(crate) fn emit_const(
  402|    762|    const_id: ConstValueId,
  403|    762|    output: &mut Vec<u8>,
  404|    762|    ctx: &EmitContext,
  405|    762|    mut module: Option<&mut ObjectModule>,
  406|    762|    mut data_description: Option<&mut DataDescription>,
  407|    762|    offset: u32,
  408|    762|) -> Result<(), String> {
  409|    762|    let const_value = ctx
  410|    762|        .mir
  411|    762|        .constants
  412|    762|        .get(&const_id)
  413|    762|        .ok_or_else(|| format!("Constant ID {} not found", const_id.get()))?;
                                     ^0      ^0                          ^0       ^0     ^0
  414|       |
  415|    762|    let ty = ctx.mir.get_type(const_value.ty);
  416|       |
  417|    762|    match &const_value.kind {
  418|    671|        ConstValueKind::Int(val) => emit_const_int(*val, ty, output),
  419|      7|        ConstValueKind::Float(val) => emit_const_float(*val, ty, output),
  420|      0|        ConstValueKind::Bool(val) => {
  421|      0|            let byte = if *val { 1u8 } else { 0u8 };
  422|      0|            output.push(byte);
  423|      0|            Ok(())
  424|       |        }
  425|       |        ConstValueKind::Null => {
  426|       |            // Emit null as all zeros (pointer-sized)
  427|      0|            let null_bytes = 0i64.to_le_bytes();
  428|      0|            output.extend_from_slice(&null_bytes);
  429|      0|            Ok(())
  430|       |        }
  431|       |        ConstValueKind::Zero => {
  432|       |            // Emit zeros for the entire type size
  433|     12|            let size = lower_type_size(ty, ctx.mir)? as usize;
                                                                 ^0
  434|     12|            output.extend_from_slice(&vec![0u8; size]);
  435|     12|            Ok(())
  436|       |        }
  437|      3|        ConstValueKind::GlobalAddress(global_id) => {

 1347|       |/// Helper function to resolve a MIR place to a Cranelift value
 1348|    186|fn emit_place(place: &Place, ctx: &mut BodyEmitContext, expected_type: Type) -> Result<Value, String> {
 1349|    186|    match place {
 1350|    125|        Place::Local(local_id) => {
 1351|       |            // A local place is resolved by loading from its stack slot
 1352|    125|            if let Some(stack_slot) = ctx.stack_slots.get(local_id) {
 1353|    125|                Ok(ctx.builder.ins().stack_load(expected_type, *stack_slot, 0))
 1354|       |            } else {
 1355|       |                // Zero-sized locals don't have stack slots. Return a dummy value.
 1356|       |                // This can happen with flexible array members or zero-length arrays.
 1357|      0|                Ok(ctx.builder.ins().iconst(expected_type, 0))
 1358|       |            }
 1359|       |        }
 1360|      2|        Place::Global(_global_id) => {
 1361|       |            // First, get the memory address of the global.
 1362|      2|            let addr = emit_place_addr(place, ctx)?;
                                                                ^0
 1363|       |
 1364|       |            // Then, load the value from that address.
 1365|      2|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().load(expected_type, MemFlags::new(), addr, 0))
 1366|       |        }
 1367|      0|        Place::Deref(operand) => {
 1368|       |            // The address is the value of the operand, so we load from that value
 1369|      0|            let addr = emit_operand(operand, ctx, types::I64)?;
 1370|      0|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().load(expected_type, MemFlags::new(), addr, 0))
 1371|       |        }
 1372|     34|        Place::StructField(base_place, field_index) => {
 1373|       |            // Get the address of the struct field
 1374|     34|            let addr = emit_place_addr(&Place::StructField(base_place.clone(), *field_index), ctx)?;
                                                                                                                ^0
 1375|     34|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().load(expected_type, MemFlags::new(), addr, 0))
 1376|       |        }
 1377|     25|        Place::ArrayIndex(base_place, index_operand) => {

 1385|       |/// Helper function to get the Cranelift Type of an operand
 1386|    314|fn lower_operand_type(operand: &Operand, mir: &MirProgram) -> Result<Type, String> {
 1387|    314|    match operand {
 1388|    128|        Operand::Constant(const_id) => {
 1389|    128|            let const_value = mir.constants.get(const_id).expect("constant id not found");
 1390|    128|            let mir_type = mir.get_type(const_value.ty);
 1391|       |
 1392|       |            // If we have a specific type for the constant, use that to determine the Cranelift type
 1393|    128|            if let Some(clif_type) = lower_type(mir_type) {
                                      ^91
 1394|     91|                return Ok(clif_type);
 1395|     37|            }
 1396|       |
 1397|       |            // Fallback to kind-based determination if type is not convertible (e.g., struct/array)
 1398|     37|            match &const_value.kind {
 1399|       |                // Integer literals in MIR are typically used in integer-sized contexts
 1400|       |                // Default to I32 so common small integer constants (like `4`) match i32
 1401|       |                // places instead of being treated as 64-bit immediates.
 1402|      0|                ConstValueKind::Int(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1403|      0|                ConstValueKind::Float(_) => Ok(types::F64),
 1404|      0|                ConstValueKind::Bool(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1405|       |                // Null/Zero/Global addresses are pointer-sized
 1406|     37|                ConstValueKind::Null | ConstValueKind::Zero | ConstValueKind::GlobalAddress(_) => Ok(types::I64),
 1407|      0|                ConstValueKind::FunctionAddress(_) => Ok(types::I64),
 1408|      0|                ConstValueKind::StructLiteral(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1409|      0|                ConstValueKind::ArrayLiteral(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1410|       |            }
 1411|       |        }
 1412|     99|        Operand::Copy(place) => {
 1413|     99|            let place_type_id = lower_place_type_id(place, mir);
 1414|     99|            let place_type = mir.get_type(place_type_id);
 1415|     99|            if place_type.is_aggregate() {
 1416|      1|                return Ok(types::I64);
 1417|     98|            }
 1418|     98|            lower_type(place_type).ok_or_else(|| format!("Unsupported place type: {:?}", place_type))
                                                               ^0      ^0
 1419|       |        }
 1420|     83|        Operand::Cast(type_id, _) => {
 1421|     83|            let mir_type = mir.get_type(*type_id);
 1422|     83|            if mir_type.is_aggregate() {
 1423|      0|                return Ok(types::I64);
 1424|     83|            }
 1425|     83|            Ok(lower_type(mir_type).unwrap_or(types::I32))
 1426|       |        }
 1427|      4|        Operand::AddressOf(_) => Ok(types::I64), // AddressOf always returns a pointer
 1428|       |    }

 1516|    235|fn emit_place_addr(place: &Place, ctx: &mut BodyEmitContext) -> Result<Value, String> {
 1517|    235|    match place {
 1518|    102|        Place::Local(local_id) => {

  821|     59|    fn lower_recursive_record_pattern(
  822|     59|        &mut self,
  823|     59|        type_ref: TypeRef,
  824|     59|        tag: Option<NameId>,
  825|     59|        members: Vec<StructMember>,
  826|     59|        is_union: bool,
  827|     59|        is_complete: bool,

  830|     59|        self.type_conversion_in_progress.insert(type_ref);
  831|     59|        let placeholder_name = NameId::new(format!("__recursive_placeholder_{}", type_ref.get()));
  832|     59|        let placeholder_type = MirType::Record {
  833|     59|            name: placeholder_name,
  834|     59|            field_types: Vec::new(),
  835|     59|            field_names: Vec::new(),
  836|     59|            is_union: false,
  837|     59|            layout: MirRecordLayout {
  838|     59|                size: 0,
  839|     59|                alignment: 0,
  840|     59|                field_offsets: Vec::new(),
  841|     59|            },
  842|     59|        };
  843|     59|        let placeholder_id = self.mir_builder.add_type(placeholder_type);
  844|     59|        self.type_cache.insert(type_ref, placeholder_id);
  845|       |
  846|     59|        let mir_type = self.lower_record_type(type_ref, &tag, &members, is_union, is_complete);
  847|       |
  848|       |        // Remove from in-progress set

  850|       |
  851|       |        // Replace the placeholder entry with the real type

  512|     14|    pub(crate) fn emit_bool_normalization(
  513|     14|        &mut self,
  514|     14|        value_op: Operand,
  515|     14|        result_place: Place,
  516|     14|        merge_block: crate::mir::MirBlockId,
  517|     14|    ) {
  518|     14|        let true_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  519|     14|        let false_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  520|       |
  521|     14|        self.mir_builder
  522|     14|            .set_terminator(Terminator::If(value_op, true_block, false_block));
  523|       |
  524|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(true_block);
  525|     14|        let one_op = self.create_int_operand(1);
  526|     14|        self.mir_builder
  527|     14|            .add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(result_place.clone(), Rvalue::Use(one_op)));
  528|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(merge_block));
  529|       |
  530|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(false_block);
  531|     14|        let zero_op = self.create_int_operand(0);
  532|     14|        self.mir_builder
  533|     14|            .add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(result_place.clone(), Rvalue::Use(zero_op)));
  534|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(merge_block));
  535|     14|    }

  537|     14|    pub(crate) fn emit_logical_op(
  538|     14|        &mut self,
  539|     14|        op: &BinaryOp,
  540|     14|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  541|     14|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  542|     14|        mir_ty: TypeId,
  543|     14|    ) -> Operand {
  544|       |        // Short-circuiting logic for && and ||
  545|     14|        let (_res_local, res_place) = self.create_temp_local(mir_ty);
  546|       |
  547|     14|        let eval_rhs_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  548|     14|        let merge_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  549|     14|        let short_circuit_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  550|       |
  551|       |        // 1. Evaluate LHS
  552|     14|        let lhs_op = self.lower_condition(left_ref);
  553|       |
  554|       |        // Pre-create constants to avoid double borrow
  555|     14|        let zero_op = self.create_int_operand(0);
  556|     14|        let one_op = self.create_int_operand(1);
  557|       |
  558|     14|        let (short_circuit_val, true_target, false_target) = match op {
  559|      7|            BinaryOp::LogicAnd => (zero_op.clone(), eval_rhs_block, short_circuit_block),
  560|      7|            BinaryOp::LogicOr => (one_op.clone(), short_circuit_block, eval_rhs_block),
  561|      0|            _ => unreachable!(),
  562|       |        };
  563|       |
  564|       |        // if lhs { goto true_target } else { goto false_target }
  565|     14|        self.mir_builder
  566|     14|            .set_terminator(Terminator::If(lhs_op, true_target, false_target));
  567|       |
  568|       |        // Short circuit case
  569|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(short_circuit_block);
  570|     14|        self.mir_builder
  571|     14|            .add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(res_place.clone(), Rvalue::Use(short_circuit_val)));
  572|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(merge_block));
  573|       |
  574|       |        // 2. Evaluate RHS
  575|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(eval_rhs_block);
  576|     14|        let rhs_val = self.lower_condition(right_ref);
  577|       |
  578|     14|        self.emit_bool_normalization(rhs_val, res_place.clone(), merge_block);
  579|       |
  580|       |        // Merge
  581|     14|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(merge_block);
  582|     14|        self.current_block = Some(merge_block);
  583|       |
  584|     14|        Operand::Copy(Box::new(res_place))
  585|     14|    }

  622|    107|    pub(crate) fn emit_pointer_arithmetic(
  623|    107|        &mut self,
  624|    107|        op: &BinaryOp,
  625|    107|        lhs: Operand,
  626|    107|        rhs: Operand,
  627|    107|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  628|    107|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  629|    107|    ) -> Option<Rvalue> {
  630|       |        // Lower types and apply conversions locally to check for pointer arithmetic
  631|       |        // We use the operand's own type as the target for conversion to avoid forcing
  632|       |        // implicit casts to the result type (which causes issues for Ptr + Int -> Ptr)
  633|    107|        let lhs_ty = self.ast.get_resolved_type(left_ref).unwrap();
  634|    107|        let rhs_ty = self.ast.get_resolved_type(right_ref).unwrap();
  635|       |
  636|    107|        let lhs_mir_target = self.lower_qual_type(lhs_ty);
  637|    107|        let rhs_mir_target = self.lower_qual_type(rhs_ty);
  638|       |
  639|    107|        let lhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(lhs, left_ref, lhs_mir_target);
  640|    107|        let rhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(rhs, right_ref, rhs_mir_target);
  641|       |
  642|    107|        let lhs_mir_ty = self.get_operand_type(&lhs_converted);
  643|    107|        let rhs_mir_ty = self.get_operand_type(&rhs_converted);
  644|       |
  645|    107|        let lhs_type_info = self.mir_builder.get_type(lhs_mir_ty);
  646|    107|        let rhs_type_info = self.mir_builder.get_type(rhs_mir_ty);
  647|       |
  648|    107|        match op {
  649|       |            BinaryOp::Add => {
  650|     20|                if lhs_type_info.is_pointer() && rhs_type_info.is_int() {
                                                               ^2            ^2
  651|      0|                    Some(self.create_pointer_arithmetic_rvalue(lhs_converted, rhs_converted, BinaryOp::Add))
  652|     20|                } else if rhs_type_info.is_pointer() && lhs_type_info.is_int() {
                                                                      ^2            ^2
  653|      0|                    Some(self.create_pointer_arithmetic_rvalue(rhs_converted, lhs_converted, BinaryOp::Add))

  701|     91|    pub(crate) fn emit_assignment_expr(
  702|     91|        &mut self,
  703|     91|        node_ref: NodeRef,
  704|     91|        op: &BinaryOp,
  705|     91|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  706|     91|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  707|     91|        mir_ty: TypeId,
  708|     91|    ) -> Operand {
  709|     91|        debug_assert!(
  710|     91|            op.is_assignment(),
  711|      0|            "emit_assignment_expr called with non-assignment operator: {:?}",
  712|       |            op
  713|       |        );
  714|       |
  715|       |        // Ensure the LHS is a place. If not, this is a semantic error.
  716|     91|        if self.ast.get_value_category(left_ref) != Some(ValueCategory::LValue) {
  717|      0|            panic!("LHS of assignment must be an lvalue");
  718|     91|        }
  719|       |
  720|       |        // Use emit_expression_as_place to properly resolve the destination place
  721|     91|        let place = self.emit_expression_as_place(left_ref);
  722|       |
  723|     91|        let rhs_op = self.emit_expression(right_ref, true);
  724|       |

                                                  ^11
  726|     11|            self.emit_compound_assignment(
  727|     11|                node_ref,
  728|     11|                compound_op,
  729|     11|                place.clone(),
  730|     11|                rhs_op,
  731|     11|                left_ref,
  732|     11|                right_ref,
  733|     11|                mir_ty,
  734|       |            )
  735|       |        } else {
  736|       |            // Simple assignment, just use the RHS
  737|     80|            self.apply_conversions(rhs_op, right_ref, mir_ty)
  738|       |        };
  739|       |
  740|     91|        self.emit_assignment(place, final_rhs.clone());
  741|     91|        final_rhs // C assignment expressions evaluate to the assigned value
  742|     91|    }

  744|     11|    pub(crate) fn emit_compound_assignment(
  745|     11|        &mut self,
  746|     11|        node_ref: NodeRef,
  747|     11|        compound_op: BinaryOp,
  748|     11|        place: Place,
  749|     11|        rhs_op: Operand,
  750|     11|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  751|     11|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  752|     11|        mir_ty: TypeId,
  753|     11|    ) -> Operand {
  754|       |        // This is a compound assignment, e.g., a += b
  755|       |        // Use the already-evaluated place to read the current value.
  756|     11|        let lhs_copy = Operand::Copy(Box::new(place));
  757|       |
  758|     11|        let (rval, op_ty) =
  759|     11|            self.emit_binary_arithmetic_logic(&compound_op, lhs_copy, rhs_op, left_ref, right_ref, mir_ty);
  760|     11|        let result_op = self.emit_rvalue_to_operand(rval, op_ty);
  761|     11|        self.apply_conversions(result_op, node_ref, mir_ty)
  762|     11|    }

  791|     76|    fn emit_function_call_args(&mut self, call_expr: &ast::nodes::CallExpr) -> Vec<Operand> {

  910|     15|    pub(crate) fn emit_inc_dec_expression(
  911|     15|        &mut self,
  912|     15|        operand_ref: NodeRef,
  913|     15|        is_inc: bool,
  914|     15|        is_post: bool,
  915|     15|        need_value: bool,
  916|     15|    ) -> Operand {
  917|     15|        let operand = self.emit_expression(operand_ref, true);
  918|     15|        let operand_ty = self.ast.get_resolved_type(operand_ref).unwrap();
  919|     15|        let mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(operand_ty);
  920|       |
  921|     15|        if self.ast.get_value_category(operand_ref) != Some(ValueCategory::LValue) {
  922|      0|            panic!("Inc/Dec operand must be an lvalue");
  923|     15|        }
  924|       |
  925|     15|        let place = if let Operand::Copy(place) = operand.clone() {
  926|     15|            place
  927|       |        } else {
  928|      0|            panic!("Inc/Dec operand is not a place");
  929|       |        };
  930|       |
  931|       |        // If it's post-inc/dec and we need the value, save the old value
  932|     15|        let old_value = if is_post && need_value {
                                                    ^13
  933|      6|            let rval = Rvalue::Use(operand.clone());
  934|      6|            let (_, temp_place) = self.create_temp_local_with_assignment(rval, mir_ty);
  935|      6|            Some(Operand::Copy(Box::new(temp_place)))
  936|       |        } else {
  937|      9|            None
  938|       |        };
  939|       |
  940|       |        // Determine MIR operation and Rvalue
  941|     15|        let rval = self.create_inc_dec_rvalue(operand.clone(), operand_ty, is_inc);
  942|       |
  943|       |        // Perform the assignment
  944|     15|        if is_post && !need_value {
                                    ^13
  945|      7|            // Optimization: assign directly to place if old value not needed
  946|      7|            self.mir_builder.add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(*place.clone(), rval));
  947|      7|        } else {
  948|       |            // If we needed old value (is_post), or if it is pre-inc (need new value),
  949|       |            // we compute to a temp first to ensure correctness and return the right value.
  950|      8|            let (_, new_place) = self.create_temp_local_with_assignment(rval, mir_ty);
  951|      8|            self.emit_assignment(*place.clone(), Operand::Copy(Box::new(new_place.clone())));
  952|       |
  953|      8|            if !is_post {
  954|       |                // Pre-inc: return the new value
  955|      2|                return Operand::Copy(Box::new(new_place));
  956|      6|            }
  957|       |        }
  958|       |
  959|     13|        if is_post {
  960|     13|            if need_value {
  961|      6|                old_value.unwrap()
  962|       |            } else {
  963|      7|                self.create_int_operand(0)
  964|       |            }
  965|       |        } else {
  966|       |            // Pre-inc: we already returned inside the block above.
  967|       |            // RE-FETCH from place as a fallback (should not be reached)
  968|      0|            Operand::Copy(place)
  969|       |        }
  970|     15|    }

  972|     15|    pub(crate) fn create_inc_dec_rvalue(&mut self, operand: Operand, operand_ty: QualType, is_inc: bool) -> Rvalue {
  973|     15|        let one_const = self.create_int_operand(1);
  974|     15|        let minus_one_const = self.create_int_operand(-1);
  975|       |
  976|     15|        if operand_ty.is_pointer() {
  977|      4|            let op = if is_inc { BinaryOp::Add } else { BinaryOp::Sub };
                                                                      ^0
  978|      4|            self.create_pointer_arithmetic_rvalue(operand, one_const, op)
  979|       |        } else {
  980|     11|            let mir_ty_id = self.lower_qual_type(operand_ty);
  981|     11|            let mir_ty = self.mir_builder.get_type(mir_ty_id);
  982|       |
  983|     11|            if mir_ty.is_float() {
  984|      0|                let val = if is_inc { 1.0 } else { -1.0 };
  985|      0|                let const_val = self.create_constant(mir_ty_id, ConstValueKind::Float(val));
  986|      0|                let rhs = Operand::Constant(const_val);
  987|      0|                Rvalue::BinaryFloatOp(crate::mir::BinaryFloatOp::Add, operand, rhs)
  988|       |            } else {
  989|       |                // For Integers: Add(delta) (Note: we use Add with negative delta for decrement
  990|       |                // to support proper wrapping arithmetic and fix previous bugs)
  991|     11|                let rhs = if is_inc { one_const } else { minus_one_const };
                                                    ^6                 ^5
  992|     11|                Rvalue::BinaryIntOp(BinaryIntOp::Add, operand, rhs)
  993|       |            }
  994|       |        }
  995|     15|    }

 1034|     10|    pub(crate) fn emit_atomic_op(
 1035|     10|        &mut self,
 1036|     10|        op: AtomicOp,
 1037|     10|        args_start: NodeRef,
 1038|     10|        args_len: u16,

 1061|       |                // args[2] is memorder, ignored
 1062|      1|                let rval = Rvalue::AtomicExchange(ptr, val, order);
 1063|      1|                self.emit_rvalue_to_operand(rval, mir_ty)
 1064|       |            }

   29|    102|pub(crate) fn map_ast_binary_op_to_mir_int(ast_op: &BinaryOp) -> BinaryIntOp {

   40|      1|        BinaryOp::LShift => BinaryIntOp::LShift,
   41|      1|        BinaryOp::RShift => BinaryIntOp::RShift,
   42|     16|        BinaryOp::Equal => BinaryIntOp::Eq,
   43|     37|        BinaryOp::NotEqual => BinaryIntOp::Ne,
   44|      3|        BinaryOp::Less => BinaryIntOp::Lt,
   45|      1|        BinaryOp::LessEqual => BinaryIntOp::Le,
   46|      3|        BinaryOp::Greater => BinaryIntOp::Gt,
   47|      1|        BinaryOp::GreaterEqual => BinaryIntOp::Ge,

   52|       |    }

  539|      1|    fn create_snippet<'a>(

  559|      1|                .label(message),

  561|       |

  565|       |    /// Format a single diagnostic with rich source code context
  566|      1|    fn format_diagnostic(&self, diag: &Diagnostic, source_manager: &SourceManager) -> String {

  568|      1|            Renderer::styled().decor_style(DecorStyle::Unicode)
  569|       |        } else {
  570|      0|            Renderer::plain()

  572|       |

  591|       |

    8|       |    // Clap does not strictly support single-dash long options (e.g. -std=c99), so we manually
    9|       |    // map them to double-dash options (e.g. --std=c99) before parsing.
   10|      0|    let args = std::env::args().map(|arg| {
   11|      0|        if arg.starts_with("-std=") || arg.starts_with("-target=") {
   12|      0|            format!("-{}", arg)
   13|      0|        } else if arg == "-pedantic" {
   14|      0|            "--pedantic".to_string()
   15|      0|        } else if arg == "-pedantic-errors" {
   16|      0|            "--pedantic-errors".to_string()
   17|       |        } else {
   18|      0|            arg
   19|       |        }
   20|      0|    });
   21|       |
   22|      0|    let cli = Cli::parse_from(args);
   23|       |
   24|      0|    match CompilerDriver::new(cli) {
   25|      0|        Ok(mut driver) => {
   26|      0|            match driver.run() {
   27|      0|                Ok(_) => std::process::exit(0),
   28|      0|                Err(e) => {
   29|      0|                    match e {
   30|      0|                        DriverError::IoError(e) => eprintln!("I/O error: {:?}", e),
   31|      0|                        DriverError::CompilationFailed => (), // diagnostic already printed by driver.run()
   32|       |                    };
   33|      0|                    std::process::exit(1);
   34|       |                }
   35|       |            }
   36|       |        }
   37|      0|        Err(e) => {
   38|      0|            eprintln!("Failed to initialize compiler: {}", e);
   39|      0|            std::process::exit(1);
   40|       |        }
   41|       |    }
   42|       |}

    1|       |//! Mid-level Intermediate Representation (MIR) for C11 compiler.
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module provides the MIR data structures and APIs for representing
    4|       |//! C11 programs after semantic analysis. The MIR is designed to be:
    5|       |//! - Typed: All entities have explicit types
    6|       |//! - Explicit: All C semantics are made explicit
    7|       |//! - Cranelift-friendly: Easy to lower to Cranelift IR
    8|       |//! - Non-SSA: Uses basic blocks with explicit control flow
    9|       |

  470|       |    /// Try to format a constant as a string literal if applicable
  471|     43|    fn try_format_as_string_literal(&self, global_name: &str, const_id: ConstValueId) -> Option<String> {
  472|       |        // Only format as string if the global name starts with .L.str (our anonymous string literals)
  473|     43|        if !global_name.starts_with(".L.str") {
  474|     31|            return None;
  475|     12|        }
  476|       |
  477|     12|        if let Some(const_value) = self.mir.constants.get(&const_id)
  478|     12|            && let ConstValueKind::ArrayLiteral(elements) = &const_value.kind
                                                              ^10
  479|       |        {
  480|       |            // Try to convert the array elements to a string
  481|     10|            let mut string_content = String::new();
  482|       |
  483|     83|            for &element_id in elements {
  484|     83|                let element = self.mir.constants.get(&element_id).unwrap();
  485|     83|                if let ConstValueKind::Int(byte) = &element.kind {
  486|     83|                    let byte = *byte as u8;
  487|     83|                    if byte == 0 {
  488|       |                        // Null terminator - end of string
  489|     10|                        break;
  490|     73|                    }
  491|       |
  492|     67|                    match byte {
  493|      6|                        b'\n' => string_content.push_str("\\n"),
  494|      0|                        b'\r' => string_content.push_str("\\r"),
  495|      0|                        b'\t' => string_content.push_str("\\t"),
  496|      0|                        b'\\' => string_content.push_str("\\\\"),
  497|      0|                        b'"' => string_content.push_str("\\\""),
  498|     67|                        b if (32..=126).contains(&b) => string_content.push(b as char),
  499|       |                        _ => {
  500|       |                            // Use hex escape for other non-printable characters
  501|       |                            use std::fmt::Write;
  502|      0|                            write!(&mut string_content, "\\x{:02x}", byte).ok()?;
  503|       |                        }
  504|       |                    }
  505|       |                } else {
  506|       |                    // Non-integer element, not a string
  507|      0|                    return None;
  508|       |                }
  509|       |            }
  510|       |
  511|     10|            if !string_content.is_empty() {
  512|     10|                return Some(format!("const \"{}\"", string_content));
  513|      0|            }
  514|      2|        }
  515|       |
  516|      2|        None
  517|     43|    }

  519|       |    /// Convert constant ID to string representation

  522|    287|            match &const_value.kind {

   14|       |/// Binding power for Pratt parser operator precedence

   17|       |
   18|       |impl BindingPower {

   20|       |    pub const COMMA: Self = Self(2);

   22|       |    pub const CONDITIONAL: Self = Self(6);
   23|       |    pub const LOGICAL_OR: Self = Self(8);
   24|       |    pub const LOGICAL_AND: Self = Self(10);

   39|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq)]
   40|       |pub(crate) enum Associativity {
   41|       |    Left,
   42|       |    Right,
   43|       |}
   44|       |
   45|       |/// Pratt parser implementation
   46|       |pub(crate) struct PrattParser;
   47|       |
   48|       |impl PrattParser {
   49|  2.99k|    fn get_binding_power(token_kind: TokenKind) -> Option<(BindingPower, Associativity)> {
   50|  2.99k|        match token_kind {
   51|       |            // Assignment operators (right-associative)
   52|       |            TokenKind::Assign
   53|       |            | TokenKind::PlusAssign
   54|       |            | TokenKind::MinusAssign
   55|       |            | TokenKind::StarAssign
   56|       |            | TokenKind::DivAssign
   57|       |            | TokenKind::ModAssign
   58|       |            | TokenKind::AndAssign
   59|       |            | TokenKind::OrAssign
   60|       |            | TokenKind::XorAssign
   61|       |            | TokenKind::LeftShiftAssign
   62|    130|            | TokenKind::RightShiftAssign => Some((BindingPower::ASSIGNMENT, Associativity::Right)),
   63|       |
   64|       |            // Comma operator (left-associative, lowest precedence)
   65|    417|            TokenKind::Comma => Some((BindingPower::COMMA, Associativity::Left)),
   66|       |
   67|       |            // Conditional operator (right-associative)
   68|     10|            TokenKind::Question => Some((BindingPower::CONDITIONAL, Associativity::Right)),
   69|       |
   70|       |            // Logical operators (left-associative)
   71|     22|            TokenKind::LogicOr => Some((BindingPower::LOGICAL_OR, Associativity::Left)),
   72|     24|            TokenKind::LogicAnd => Some((BindingPower::LOGICAL_AND, Associativity::Left)),
   73|       |
   74|       |            // Bitwise operators (left-associative)
   75|      1|            TokenKind::Or => Some((BindingPower::BITWISE_OR, Associativity::Left)),
   76|      1|            TokenKind::Xor => Some((BindingPower::BITWISE_XOR, Associativity::Left)),
   77|      2|            TokenKind::And => Some((BindingPower::BITWISE_AND, Associativity::Left)),
   78|       |

  777|     11|fn parse_builtin_offsetof(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError> {
  778|     11|    let token = parser.expect(TokenKind::BuiltinOffsetof)?;
                                                                       ^0
  779|     11|    let start_loc = token.span.start();
  780|       |
  781|     11|    parser.expect(TokenKind::LeftParen)?;
                                                     ^0
  782|       |
  783|       |    // Parse type
  784|     11|    let parsed_type = super::parsed_type_builder::parse_parsed_type_name(parser)?;
                                                                                              ^0
  785|       |
  786|     11|    parser.expect(TokenKind::Comma)?;
                                                 ^0
  787|       |
  788|       |    // Parse member-designator.
  789|       |    // C11 7.19p3: "The member-designator shall be such that given static type t* p;
  790|       |    // the expression &(p->member-designator) is an integer constant expression."
  791|       |    // We'll parse this into a tree of MemberAccess and IndexAccess nodes.
  792|       |    // We start with a dummy base representing 'p'.
  793|     11|    let mut current_node = parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::Dummy, parser.previous_token_span());
  794|       |
  795|       |    // First element MUST be a member name.
  796|     11|    let (first_member_name, first_member_span) = parser.expect_name()?;
                                                                                   ^0
  797|       |
  798|     11|    current_node = parser.push_node(
  799|     11|        ParsedNodeKind::MemberAccess(current_node, first_member_name, false /* is_arrow */),
  800|     11|        first_member_span,
  801|     11|    );
  802|       |
  803|       |    // Subsequent elements can be .member or [index]
  804|       |    loop {
  805|     15|        let tok = parser.current_token()?;
                                                      ^0
  806|     15|        match tok.kind {
  807|       |            TokenKind::Dot => {
  808|      2|                parser.advance();
  809|      2|                let (member_name, member_span) = parser.expect_name()?;
                                                                                   ^0
  810|      2|                current_node = parser.push_node(
  811|      2|                    ParsedNodeKind::MemberAccess(current_node, member_name, false /* is_arrow */),
  812|      2|                    tok.span.merge(member_span),
  813|      2|                );
  814|       |            }
  815|       |            TokenKind::LeftBracket => {
  816|      2|                parser.advance();
  817|      2|                let index_expr = parser.parse_expr_min()?; // Use parse_expr_min for full expression
                                                                      ^0
  818|      2|                let right_bracket = parser.expect(TokenKind::RightBracket)?;
                                                                                        ^0
  819|      2|                current_node = parser.push_node(
  820|      2|                    ParsedNodeKind::IndexAccess(current_node, index_expr),
  821|      2|                    tok.span.merge(right_bracket.span),
  822|      2|                );
  823|       |            }
  824|     11|            _ => break,
  825|       |        }
  826|       |    }
  827|       |
  828|     11|    let right_paren = parser.expect(TokenKind::RightParen)?;
                                                                        ^0
  829|     11|    let end_loc = right_paren.span.end();
  830|     11|    let span = SourceSpan::new(start_loc, end_loc);
  831|       |
  832|     11|    let node = parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::BuiltinOffsetof(parsed_type, current_node), span);
  833|     11|    Ok(node)
  834|     11|}

  474|       |    /// Get all tokens from the stream

  300|       |    /// Peek at the next character without consuming it, handling line splicing
  301|  19.3k|    pub(crate) fn peek_char(&mut self) -> Option<u8> {
  302|  19.3k|        let pos = self.position as usize;
  303|       |

                                           ^18.3k

 1153|     32|    fn is_valid_utf8_start(&self, byte: u8) -> bool {

  693|       |    /// Collect tokens balanced between open and close delimiters.

  695|      3|    fn collect_balanced_tokens(&mut self, open: PPTokenKind, close: PPTokenKind) -> Result<Vec<PPToken>, PPError> {

                                            ^0

  702|      6|            }
  703|      6|            if t.kind == open {
  704|      0|                depth += 1;
  705|      6|            } else if t.kind == close {
  706|      3|                depth -= 1;
  707|      3|                if depth == 0 {
  708|      3|                    return Ok(tokens);
  709|      0|                }
  710|      3|            }
  711|      3|            tokens.push(t);
  712|       |        }
  713|      0|        self.emit_error_loc(PPErrorKind::UnexpectedEndOfFile, self.get_current_location())
  714|      3|    }

  856|       |    /// Evaluate a conditional expression (simplified - handle defined and basic arithmetic)

  859|       |        // parse_conditional_expression already ensures no Eod tokens are present.

  861|       |        // The buggy 'defined' optimization was also removed as it incorrectly
  862|       |        // returned early for complex expressions like '#if defined(FOO) && 0'.
  863|       |        // Bolt : Optimized to take tokens by value, avoiding a redundant `to_vec()` clone.

  865|       |            // For empty expressions, treat as false
  866|      0|            return Ok(false);
  867|     17|        }

 2053|       |    /// Paste tokens for ## operator
 2054|      4|    fn paste_tokens(&mut self, left: &PPToken, right: &PPToken) -> Result<Vec<PPToken>, PPError> {

 2063|       |        };

 2069|      4|            unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(&right_buffer[right_start..right_end]) }

 2402|     69|    fn create_virtual_buffer_tokens(

 2409|       |        // This function is a hot path during macro expansion. We've optimized it by:
 2410|       |        // 1. Using a single pass to build the virtual buffer and collect token metadata.
 2411|       |        // 2. Caching SourceId lookups and 'is_pasted' checks to avoid redundant HashMap

 2622|     36|    fn get_token_bytes<'b>(&'b mut self, token: &'b PPToken) -> &'b [u8] {
 2623|     36|        let sid = token.location.source_id();
 2624|     36|        let buffer = if self.last_sid == Some(sid) {
 2625|     14|            self.last_buffer.unwrap()
 2626|     22|        } else if let Some(b) = self.sm.get_buffer_safe(sid) {
 2627|       |            // Bolt : Cache the buffer for the current source ID.
 2628|     22|            self.last_sid = Some(sid);
 2629|     22|            self.last_buffer = Some(b);
 2630|     22|            b
 2631|       |        } else {
 2632|       |            // Fallback for built-in tokens or tokens without a physical buffer.
 2633|      0|            return token.get_text().as_bytes();
 2634|       |        };
 2635|       |
 2636|     36|        let start = token.location.offset() as usize;
 2637|     36|        let end = start + token.length as usize;
 2638|     36|        if end <= buffer.len() {
 2639|     36|            &buffer[start..end]
 2640|       |        } else {
 2641|      0|            token.get_text().as_bytes()
 2642|       |        }
 2643|     36|    }
 2644|       |

 2646|       |        // Safety: Tokens are guaranteed to be valid UTF-8 by the lexer.
 2647|     16|        unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(self.get_token_bytes(token)) }

  826|       |/// Merge base types according to C type combination rules
  827|  1.59k|fn merge_base_type(
  828|  1.59k|    existing: Option<QualType>,
  829|  1.59k|    new_type: QualType,
  830|  1.59k|    ctx: &mut LowerCtx,
  831|  1.59k|    span: SourceSpan,
  832|  1.59k|) -> Option<QualType> {
  833|  1.59k|    match existing {
  834|  1.48k|        None => Some(new_type),
  835|    113|        Some(existing_ref) => {
  836|    113|            let existing_type = ctx.registry.get(existing_ref.ty());
  837|    113|            let new_type_info = ctx.registry.get(new_type.ty());
  838|       |
  839|    113|            match (&existing_type.kind, &new_type_info.kind) {
  840|    113|                (TypeKind::Builtin(existing_builtin), TypeKind::Builtin(new_builtin)) => {
  841|    113|                    match (existing_builtin, new_builtin) {
  842|       |                        // 1. Same types (redundancy)
  843|    113|                        (a, b) if a == b => {
                                       ^1 ^1         ^1
  844|       |                            // C99/C11: int int is NOT allowed, but long long is.
  845|       |                            // However, many compilers allow redundant specifiers.
  846|       |                            // In Cendol, we'll allow it if they are identical,
  847|       |                            // EXCEPT for types that already have a combined form (like long long).

   29|       |/// This structure is typically populated during the semantic analysis phase.
   30|       |/// Symbol are stored in a separate Vec<Symbol> with SymbolRef references.
   31|       |/// invariant:

   33|       |/// - EnumConstant: type_info = int (unqualified)

  476|       |    /// This implements C11 6.9.2 for handling tentative definitions, extern declarations, and actual definitions.
  477|    624|    fn merge_global_symbol(&mut self, name: NameId, mut new_entry: Symbol) -> Result<SymbolRef, SymbolTableError> {

  758|    113|    fn compute_record_layout(&mut self, members: &[StructMember], is_union: bool) -> Result<TypeLayout, SemanticError> {
  759|    113|        let mut max_align = 1;
  760|    113|        let mut current_size = 0;
  761|    113|        let mut field_layouts = Vec::with_capacity(members.len());
  762|       |        // For C11 6.7.2.1p18 flexible array check:
  763|       |        // "the last element of a structure with more than one named member may have an incomplete array type"
  764|       |        // But incomplete array types are NOT allowed in unions.
  765|       |        // We will check validity as we iterate.
  766|       |        // Note: The count of members might include anonymous struct/union members which are technically members.
  767|       |
  768|    113|        let member_count = members.len();
  769|       |
  770|    193|        for (i, member) in members.iter().enumerate() {
                                         ^113    ^113   ^113
  771|    193|            let member_ty = member.member_type.ty();
  772|       |
  773|       |            // Special handling for flexible array member (FAM)
  774|       |            // Need to check if it is incomplete array
  775|       |            // We can't use is_complete because that recurses. We check TypeKind directly.
  776|    193|            let is_incomplete_or_vla_array = if member_ty.is_inline_array() {
  777|     11|                false // inline array always has len
  778|       |            } else {
  779|    178|                matches!(
  780|    182|                    self.get(member_ty).kind,
  781|       |                    TypeKind::Array {
  782|       |                        size: ArraySizeType::Incomplete | ArraySizeType::Variable(_),
  783|       |                        ..
  784|       |                    }
  785|       |                )
  786|       |            };
  787|       |
  788|    193|            if is_incomplete_or_vla_array {
  789|      4|                if is_union {
  790|       |                    // Incomplete or VLA types not allowed in union
  791|      1|                    return Err(SemanticError::UnsupportedFeature {
  792|      1|                        feature: "incomplete/VLA array in union".to_string(),
  793|      1|                        span: member.span,
  794|      1|                    });
  795|      3|                }
  796|       |
  797|       |                // Must be last member
  798|      3|                if i != member_count - 1 {
  799|      1|                    return Err(SemanticError::FlexibleArrayNotLast { span: member.span });
  800|      2|                }
  801|       |
  802|       |                // Must have at least one other named member.
  803|       |                // Or rather, "structure with more than one named member".
  804|       |                // If this is the only member, it's invalid.
  805|      2|                if member_count < 2 {
  806|      1|                    return Err(SemanticError::FlexibleArrayInEmptyStruct { span: member.span });
  807|      1|                }
  808|       |
  809|       |                // If valid FAM:
  810|       |                // Size of structure is as if FAM was omitted.
  811|       |                // But we must respect its alignment for the struct's alignment.
  812|       |                // We need to get the element type to find alignment.
  813|      1|                let elem_ty = match &self.get(member_ty).kind {
  814|      1|                    TypeKind::Array { element_type, .. } => *element_type,
  815|      0|                    _ => unreachable!(),
  816|       |                };
  817|      1|                let elem_layout = self.ensure_layout(elem_ty)?;
                                                                           ^0
  818|       |
  819|      1|                max_align = max_align.max(elem_layout.alignment);
  820|       |
  821|       |                // FAM has size 0 for layout purposes of the struct size,
  822|       |                // but its offset is where it would start.
  823|       |                // The standard says: "size of the structure is as if the flexible array member were omitted"
  824|       |                // This means current_size stays as is (after padding for alignment of FAM? No, omitted means omitted).
  825|       |                // "except that it may have more trailing padding than the omission would imply"
  826|       |                // Usually this is interpreted as: sizeof(struct) = max(sizeof(struct_without_fam), offsetof(fam)).
  827|       |                // Or simply: layout the FAM, but don't increment current_size by its size (which is unknown/0).
  828|       |                // But we might need to add padding to current_size to reach FAM alignment?
  829|       |                // "as if the flexible array member were omitted" implies we don't even add padding for it?
  830|       |                // BUT "except that it may have more trailing padding".
  831|       |                // Most compilers align the end of the struct to the alignment of the FAM.
  832|       |
  833|       |                // Let's compute offset.
  834|      1|                let offset = (current_size + elem_layout.alignment - 1) & !(elem_layout.alignment - 1);
  835|      1|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset });
  836|       |
  837|       |                // We do NOT update current_size with FAM size (which is effectively 0 or variable).
  838|       |                // But we might update current_size to offset?
  839|       |                // GCC: sizeof(struct { int x; int y[]; }) == 4.
  840|       |                //      sizeof(struct { char c; int y[]; }) == 4 (aligned to 4).
  841|       |                // So we do align current_size.
  842|      1|                current_size = offset;
  843|       |
  844|      1|                continue;
  845|    189|            }
  846|       |
  847|    189|            let layout = self.ensure_layout(member_ty)?;
                                                                    ^0
  848|    189|            let mut member_align = layout.alignment;
  849|    189|            if let Some(req_align) = member.alignment {
                                      ^5
  850|      5|                member_align = member_align.max(req_align as u16);
  851|    184|            }
  852|    189|            max_align = max_align.max(member_align);
  853|       |
  854|    189|            if is_union {
  855|     15|                current_size = current_size.max(layout.size);
  856|     15|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset: 0 });
  857|    174|            } else {
  858|    174|                // Align current_size to member's alignment to find its offset
  859|    174|                let offset = (current_size + member_align - 1) & !(member_align - 1);
  860|    174|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset });
  861|    174|                current_size = offset + layout.size;
  862|    174|            }
  863|       |        }
  864|       |
  865|       |        // Final size is padded to the record's max alignment
  866|    110|        let final_size = (current_size + max_align - 1) & !(max_align - 1);
  867|       |

  870|    110|            alignment: max_align,
  871|    110|            kind: LayoutKind::Record {

  873|    110|                is_union,
  874|    110|            },
  875|    110|        })
  876|    113|    }

  878|    289|    pub(crate) fn decay(&mut self, qt: QualType, ptr_qualifiers: TypeQualifiers) -> QualType {
  879|    289|        let kind = self.get(qt.ty()).kind.clone();
  880|    289|        match kind {
  881|     73|            TypeKind::Array { element_type, .. } => {
  882|       |                // Correct logic: Array of T decays to Pointer to T.
  883|       |                // Qualifiers on Array apply to the element in the resulting pointer type.
  884|     73|                let elem_qt = QualType::new(element_type, qt.qualifiers());
  885|     73|                let ptr = self.pointer_to(elem_qt);
  886|       |                // Apply the extracted pointer qualifiers (e.g. from static/const inside [])
  887|     73|                QualType::new(ptr, ptr_qualifiers)
  888|       |            }
  889|       |            TypeKind::Function { .. } => {
  890|     10|                let ptr = self.pointer_to(qt);
  891|     10|                QualType::new(ptr, ptr_qualifiers)
  892|       |            }
  893|    206|            _ => qt,
  894|       |        }
  895|    289|    }

  905|    104|    pub(crate) fn is_compatible(&self, a: QualType, b: QualType) -> bool {
  906|    104|        if a == b {
  907|     57|            return true;
  908|     47|        }
  909|       |
  910|     47|        if a.qualifiers() != b.qualifiers() {

  913|       |
  914|     28|        let ty_a_ref = a.ty();
  915|     28|        let ty_b_ref = b.ty();
  916|       |
  917|     28|        if ty_a_ref == ty_b_ref {
  918|      0|            return true;
  919|     28|        }
  920|       |
  921|     28|        let kind_a = self.get(ty_a_ref).kind.clone();
  922|     28|        let kind_b = self.get(ty_b_ref).kind.clone();

  927|      0|                    element_type: elem_a,
  928|      0|                    size: size_a,
  929|       |                },
  930|       |                TypeKind::Array {
  931|      0|                    element_type: elem_b,
  932|      0|                    size: size_b,
  933|       |                },
  934|       |            ) => {
  935|      0|                if !self.is_compatible(QualType::unqualified(elem_a), QualType::unqualified(elem_b)) {
  936|      0|                    return false;
  937|      0|                }
  938|      0|                match (size_a, size_b) {

 1076|    314|    pub(crate) fn is_complete(&self, ty: TypeRef) -> bool {
 1077|    314|        if ty.is_inline_pointer() {
 1078|     27|            return true;
 1079|    287|        }

 1081|       |            // Array is complete if element is complete
 1082|       |            // But strict C says array valid if element type is complete (except local VLA which is complete at runtime allocation point?)

 1085|     25|            return self.is_complete(elem);
 1086|    262|        }

 1091|      0|            TypeKind::Enum { is_complete, .. } => *is_complete,

 1093|      3|                if let ArraySizeType::Incomplete = size {

  245|       |/// Opaque reference to a canonical type.
  246|       |/// Internally index + 1 (NonZeroU32 for niche optimization).
  247|       |#[derive(Copy, Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, Hash, Serialize)]
  248|       |#[repr(transparent)]
  249|       |pub struct TypeRef(NonZeroU32);
  250|       |
  251|       |impl TypeRef {
  252|       |    // Layout:
  253|       |    // bit  0..=17  (18 bit)  BASE INDEX
  254|       |    // bit 18..=20  (3 bit)   TYPE CLASS
  255|       |    // bit 21..=22  (2 bit)   POINTER DEPTH (0..3)
  256|       |    // bit 23..=27  (5 bit)   ARRAY LEN INLINE (0..31)
  257|       |
  258|       |    const BASE_BITS: u32 = 18;
  259|       |    const CLASS_BITS: u32 = 3;
  260|       |    const PTR_BITS: u32 = 2;
  261|       |    const ARR_BITS: u32 = 5;
  262|       |
  263|       |    const BASE_SHIFT: u32 = 0;
  264|       |    const CLASS_SHIFT: u32 = Self::BASE_BITS;
  265|       |    const PTR_SHIFT: u32 = Self::CLASS_SHIFT + Self::CLASS_BITS;
  266|       |    const ARR_SHIFT: u32 = Self::PTR_SHIFT + Self::PTR_BITS;
  267|       |
  268|       |    const BASE_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::BASE_BITS) - 1;
  269|       |    const CLASS_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::CLASS_BITS) - 1;
  270|       |    const PTR_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::PTR_BITS) - 1;
  271|       |    const ARR_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::ARR_BITS) - 1;
  272|       |
  273|       |    #[inline]
  274|  12.5k|    pub(crate) fn new(base_index: u32, class: TypeClass, ptr_depth: u8, arr_len: u32) -> Option<Self> {
  275|  12.5k|        if base_index == 0 || base_index > Self::BASE_MASK {
  276|      0|            return None; // Base index must be non-zero and fit in 18 bits
  277|  12.5k|        }
  278|  12.5k|        if ptr_depth as u32 > Self::PTR_MASK {
  279|      1|            return None;
  280|  12.5k|        }
  281|  12.5k|        if arr_len > Self::ARR_MASK {
  282|      1|            return None;
  283|  12.5k|        }
  284|       |
  285|       |        // Validate combinations
  286|  12.5k|        match class {
  287|       |            TypeClass::Builtin => {
  288|  10.5k|                if ptr_depth != 0 || arr_len != 0 {
                                                   ^10.5k
  289|      1|                    return None;
  290|  10.5k|                }
  291|       |            }
  292|       |            TypeClass::Pointer => {
  293|    758|                if arr_len != 0 {
  294|      1|                    return None;
  295|    757|                }
  296|       |                // Pointer depth 0 means "Registry Pointer" (valid)
  297|       |                // Pointer depth 1..3 means "Inline Pointer" (valid)
  298|       |            }
  299|       |            TypeClass::Array => {
  300|       |                // Array len 0 means "Registry Array" (valid)
  301|       |                // Array len 1..31 means "Inline Array" (valid)
  302|    534|                if ptr_depth != 0 {
  303|      1|                    return None;
  304|    533|                }
  305|       |            }
  306|       |            TypeClass::Function | TypeClass::Record | TypeClass::Enum | TypeClass::Typedef | TypeClass::Complex => {
  307|    669|                if ptr_depth != 0 || arr_len != 0 {
  308|      0|                    return None;
  309|    669|                }
  310|       |            }
  311|       |        }
  312|       |
  313|  12.5k|        let mut raw = 0u32;
  314|  12.5k|        raw |= base_index & Self::BASE_MASK;
  315|  12.5k|        raw |= (class as u32) << Self::CLASS_SHIFT;
  316|  12.5k|        raw |= (ptr_depth as u32) << Self::PTR_SHIFT;
  317|  12.5k|        raw |= (arr_len) << Self::ARR_SHIFT;
  318|       |
  319|  12.5k|        NonZeroU32::new(raw).map(TypeRef)
  320|  12.5k|    }
  321|       |
  322|       |    // Unsafe constructor for internal use / tests
  323|       |    #[inline]
  324|  44.0k|    pub(crate) unsafe fn from_raw_unchecked(n: u32) -> Self {
  325|  44.0k|        unsafe { TypeRef(NonZeroU32::new_unchecked(n)) }
  326|  44.0k|    }

  456|       |    /// Get line and column for a source location
  457|     24|    pub(crate) fn get_line_column(&self, loc: SourceLoc) -> Option<(u32, u32)> {
  458|     24|        let file_info = self.get_file_info(loc.source_id())?;
                          ^23                                            ^1
  459|     23|        let offset = loc.offset();
  460|       |
  461|     23|        let line_starts = &file_info.line_starts;
  462|     23|        if line_starts.is_empty() {
  463|       |            // If line_starts not calculated yet, assume single line starting at 0
  464|      1|            return Some((1, offset + 1));
  465|     22|        }
  466|       |
  467|       |        // Use partition_point which performs a binary search
  468|     76|        let idx = line_starts.partition_point(|&start| start <= offset);
                          ^22   ^22         ^22
  469|       |
  470|     22|        if idx == 0 {
  471|      1|            return Some((0, 1));
  472|     21|        }
  473|       |
  474|       |        // idx is the index of the first element GREATER than offset.
  475|       |        // The line index corresponds to the element immediately preceding usage.
  476|     21|        let line_idx = idx - 1;
  477|     21|        let line_start = line_starts[line_idx];
  478|     21|        let column = offset - line_start;
  479|       |
  480|     21|        Some((line_idx as u32 + 1, column + 1)) // 1-based indexing
  481|     24|    }
